member.name: T:PHRPReader.Data.ExtendedScanStatsFileColumns
member.summary: These columns correspond to the tab-delimited _ScanStatsEx.txt file created by MASIC or MSFileInfoScanner

member.name: T:PHRPReader.Data.InspectSynFileColumns
member.summary: These columns correspond to the Synopsis file created by InSpecTResultsProcessor

remarks.para: Computed as Abs((MQScore(n) - MQScore(n+1)) / MQScore(n)); storing 0 for the lowest scoring result in each set. If MQScore(n) is 0, stores 0.
This value is not usable when MQScore(n) is 0 or negative, and should generally not be used when MQScore(n) is less than 0.5
Computed as Abs((TotalPRMScore(n) - TotalPRMScore(n+1)) / TotalPRMScore(n)); storing 0 for the lowest scoring result in each set. If TotalPRMScore(n) is 0, stores 0.
This value is not usable when TotalPRMScore(n) is 0 or negative, and should generally not be used when TotalPRMScore(n) is less than 0.5

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.InspectSynFileColumns.RankTotalPRMScore
member.remarks: Rank 1 means highest TotalPRMScore, 2 means next lower score, etc. (ties get the same rank)

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.InspectSynFileColumns.RankFScore
member.remarks: Rank 1 means highest FScore, 2 means next lower, etc. (ties get the same rank)

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.InspectSynFileColumns.MH
member.summary: Theoretical monoisotopic peptide mass (computed by PHRP)
member.remarks: This is (M+H)+

member.name: T:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns
member.summary: These columns correspond to the Synopsis file created by MaxQuantResultsProcessor

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.Dataset
member.summary: Dataset name (typically the .raw file name, without the extension)

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.Scan
member.summary: MS/MS scan number in the dataset

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.FragMethod
member.summary: Type of fragmentation used to create the MS/MS spectrum
member.remarks: Types: CID - Collision Induced Dissociation HCD - High energy Collision induced Dissociation ETD - Electron Transfer Dissociation

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.SpecIndex
member.summary: Index of the spectrum in the dataset (1-based, consecutive integer)

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.Charge
member.summary: Charge state of the precursor ion

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.PrecursorMZ
member.summary: Precursor ion m/z (observed value, read from a _PrecursorInfo.txt file by PHRP)

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.PrecursorMZ_MaxQuant
member.summary: Precursor ion m/z (theoretical value, not observed value)
member.remarks: This is the theoretical m/z of the first isotope of the isotopic distribution of the parent ion

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.DelM
member.summary: Mass error of the precursor ion equivalent monoisotopic mass value vs. the predicted monoisotopic mass of the identified peptide sequence

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.DelM_MaxQuant
member.summary: Mass error of the precursor ion equivalent monoisotopic mass value vs. the predicted monoisotopic mass of the identified peptide sequence, as computed by MaxQuant

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.DelM_PPM_MaxQuant
member.summary: Mass error, in ppm, as computed by MaxQuant

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.MH
member.summary: Monoisotopic (M+H)+ value, computed from PrecursorMZ and Charge by PHRP
member.remarks: This is (M+H)+

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.Mass
member.summary: Theoretical monoisotopic mass of the identified sequence (uncharged, including mods), as computed by MaxQuant

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.DynamicModifications
member.summary: Comma separated list of dynamic modifications in the peptide
member.remarks: MaxQuant modification examples: Oxidation 8 Oxidation 11,Oxidation 26

remarks.para: Semicolon separated list

If the peptide is from a reverse-hit protein, the Proteins column will be empty in the _syn.txt file, and the decoy protein name will be in the LeadingRazorProtein column. When the MaxQuantSynFileReader class reads the _syn.txt file, it adds the LeadingRazorProtein name to the list of protein names, if the Proteins column is empty.

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.LeadingRazorProtein
member.summary: Name of the best scoring protein this peptide is associated with
member.remarks: Typically there is only one protein name here However, in cases of a tied score, will be a semicolon separated list

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.PEP
member.remarks: Similar to p-value Smaller values (closer to zero) are higher confidence

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.Score
member.summary: Andromeda score for the best MS/MS spectrum with this peptide
member.remarks: Larger values are better

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.DeltaScore
member.summary: Score difference to the second best identified peptide with a different amino acid sequence

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.RankScore
member.remarks: Rank 1 means highest Andromeda score, 2 means next lower score, etc. (ties get the same rank)

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.TotalPeptideIntensity
member.summary: Summed up extracted ion current (XIC) of all isotopic clusters associated with this peptide
member.remarks: All peptides with the same sequence will have the same total peptide intensity value for a given dataset

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.PrecursorType
member.summary: Type of precursor ion as identified by MaxQuant

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.ElutionTime
member.summary: Elution time of the MS/MS spectrum

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.PrecursorScan
member.summary: Scan number where the precursor ion was observed

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.PrecursorIntensity
member.summary: Intensity of the precursor ion in the scan that it was observed

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.NumberOfMatches
member.summary: Number of peaks (MS/MS ions) matching to the predicted fragmentation spectrum

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.MaxQuantSynFileColumns.IntensityCoverage
member.summary: Fraction of intensity in the MS/MS spectrum that is annotated

member.summary: This class describes an amino acid modification

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.ModificationDefinition.LAST_RESORT_MODIFICATION_SYMBOL
member.summary: Modification symbol used after all the DEFAULT_MODIFICATION_SYMBOLS have been used

member.summary: Symbol to indicate a modification does not have a mod symbol
member.remarks: Used with isotopic mods and protein terminus static mods

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.ModificationDefinition.INITIAL_UNKNOWN_MASS_CORRECTION_TAG_NAME
member.summary: Initial unknown mass correction tag name

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.ModificationDefinition.ResidueModificationType.UnknownType
member.summary: Unknown mod type on a residue; essentially treated as a dynamic mod

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.ModificationDefinition.ResidueModificationType.DynamicMod
member.summary: Dynamic mod on a residue or peptide terminus; supported by SEQUEST and notated via a modification symbol; this mod is explicitly notated by X!Tandem; if a terminus mod, the mod symbol is associated with the first or last residue in the peptide

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.ModificationDefinition.ResidueModificationType.StaticMod
member.summary: Static mod on a residue or peptide terminus; supported by SEQUEST but not explicitly notated; this mod is explicitly notated by X!Tandem; if a terminus mod, the mod symbol is associated with the first or last residue in the peptide

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.ModificationDefinition.ResidueModificationType.TerminalPeptideStaticMod
member.summary: Peptide terminus static mod (DMS Symbol is T); used by SEQUEST and MSGFDB; note that terminal mods are always dynamic in X!Tandem

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.ModificationDefinition.ResidueModificationType.IsotopicMod
member.summary: Isotopic mod, e.g. N15, or C13; supported by SEQUEST; most likely not supported by XTandem

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.ModificationDefinition.ResidueModificationType.ProteinTerminusStaticMod
member.summary: Protein terminus static mod; supported by SEQUEST; this mod is also supported by X!Tandem but modified residues are not explicitly notated; instead, all peptides have their mass implicitly modified by this amount

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.ModificationDefinition.mAffectedAtom
member.summary: For Isotopic modifications, indicate the atom affected (e.g. C, H, N, O, or S) Otherwise, set to PeptideMassCalculator.NO_AFFECTED_ATOM_SYMBOL for positional modifications (including terminus modifications)

member.name: F:PHRPReader.Data.ModificationDefinition.mModificationSymbol
member.summary: One letter symbol for this modification; use NO_SYMBOL_MODIFICATION_SYMBOL if no symbol (necessary for isotopic mods or protein terminus static mods)

member.name: P:PHRPReader.Data.ModificationDefinition.AffectedAtom
member.summary: Only used with Isotopic modifications, indicating the atom affected (e.g. C, H, N, O, or S)
member.remarks: Set to PeptideMassCalculator.NO_AFFECTED_ATOM_SYMBOL (a dash) for positional modifications (including terminus modifications)

member.name: P:PHRPReader.Data.ModificationDefinition.MassCorrectionTag
member.summary: Modification name, for example Phosph, IodoAcet, Plus1Oxy, or Methyl

remarks.para: Cannot contain a colon, comma, or space
Prior to 2020, was limited to 8 characters in length, but that restriction has been removed

member.name: P:PHRPReader.Data.ModificationDefinition.ModificationMassAsText
member.remarks: Represents the original string value read from the data file

member.name: P:PHRPReader.Data.ModificationDefinition.ModificationSymbol
member.summary: One letter symbol for this modification
member.remarks: Use NO_SYMBOL_MODIFICATION_SYMBOL (a dash) if no symbol (necessary for isotopic mods or protein terminus static mods)

member.name: P:PHRPReader.Data.ModificationDefinition.OccurrenceCount
member.summary: Number of times this modification was observed in the given dataset

member.name: P:PHRPReader.Data.ModificationDefinition.TargetResidues
member.summary: Residues that this modification can apply to, tracked as a space-free, comma-free list of one letter amino acid residue symbols

remarks.para: Use the *_SYMBOL_DMS constants for the peptide and protein termini symbols (less than and greater than signs for the peptide termini; [ and ] for the protein termini)
If an empty string, the modification can apply to any residue or terminus

member.summary: Get the modification type, by modification index

member.name: M:PHRPReader.Data.PeptideModificationContainer.LookupMassCorrectionTagByMass(System.Double)
member.summary: Find the mass correction tag with the given mass, adding to the unknown modification list if not found
member.remarks: Searches known mods using 3 digits of precision, then 2 digits, then 1 digit If no match, adds as a new, unknown modification
member.returns: Mod name, or empty string if no match

member.name: M:PHRPReader.Data.PeptideModificationContainer.LookupMassCorrectionTagByMass(System.Double,System.Byte)
member.summary: Find the mass correction tag with the given mass, adding to the unknown modification list if not found
member.remarks: Searches known mods using massDigitsOfPrecision digits of precision, then massDigitsOfPrecision-1 digits, ... 1 digit If no match, adds as a new, unknown modification
member.returns: Mod name, or empty string if no match

member.name: M:PHRPReader.Data.PeptideModificationContainer.LookupMassCorrectionTagByMass(System.Double,System.Byte,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Find the mass correction tag with the given mass, adding to the unknown modification list if not found and addToModificationListIfUnknown is true
member.remarks: Searches known mods using massDigitsOfPrecision digits of precision, then massDigitsOfPrecision-1 digits, ... 1 digit If no match, adds as a new, unknown modification
member.param: When true, add to the modification list if unknown
member.returns: Mod name, or empty string if no match

member.name: M:PHRPReader.Data.PeptideModificationContainer.LookupMassCorrectionTagByMass(System.Double,System.Byte,System.Boolean,System.Byte)
member.summary: Find the mass correction tag with the given mass, adding to the unknown modification list if not found and addToModificationListIfUnknown is true
member.param: Number of digits after the decimal point to round to when comparing mod masses
When true, add to the modification list if unknown
Number of digits after the decimal point to round to, for a more lenient match (if no match found using massDigitsOfPrecision)
member.returns: Mod name, or empty string if no match

member.name: M:PHRPReader.Data.PeptideModificationContainer.LookupDynamicModificationDefinitionByTargetInfo(System.Char,System.Char,PHRPReader.Data.AminoAcidModInfo.ResidueTerminusState,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Looks for a modification of type .DynamicMod or type .UnknownType in mModifications having .ModificationSymbol = modificationSymbol and chTargetResidue in .TargetResidues
member.remarks: If modificationSymbol does not match any of the mods, a modification with a mass of 0 is returned
member.param: Output: true if an existing modification was found
member.returns: Modification details

member.name: M:PHRPReader.Data.PeptideModificationContainer.LookupModificationDefinitionByMass(System.Double,System.Char,PHRPReader.Data.AminoAcidModInfo.ResidueTerminusState,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Looks for an existing modification with the given modification mass and target residues
member.remarks: If chTargetResidue is '\0' (which is default(char)) or AminoAcidModInfo.ResidueTerminusState.None, follows similar matching logic, but skips defined modifications with defined .TargetResidues
member.param: If defined, returns the first modification with the given mass and containing the residue in .TargetResidues; if no match, looks for the first modification with the given mass and no defined .TargetResidues
Output: true if an existing modification was found
When true, add to the modification list if unknown
Number of digits after the decimal point to round to when comparing mod masses
Number of digits after the decimal point to round to, for a more lenient match (if no match found using massDigitsOfPrecision)
member.returns: The best matched modification; if no match is found, returns a newly created modification definition, adding it to mModifications if addToModificationListIfUnknown is True

member.name: M:PHRPReader.Data.PeptideModificationContainer.LookupModificationMassByName(System.String,System.Double@)
member.summary: Resolve a modification name to a modification mass Checks both names in mMassCorrectionTags and UniMod names
member.returns: True if found, otherwise false

member.param: If defined, returns the first modification with the given mass and containing the residue in .TargetResidues; if no match, looks for the first modification with the given mass and no defined .TargetResidues
Output: true if an existing modification was found
When true, add to the modification list if unknown
Number of digits after the decimal point to round to when comparing mod masses
Number of digits after the decimal point to round to, for a more lenient match (if no match found using massDigitsOfPrecision)
member.returns: The best matched modification; if no match is found, returns a newly created modification definition, adding it to mModifications if addToModificationListIfUnknown = True

member.remarks: Ranges from 0 to 1, where 0 is the best score and 1 is the worse score Stored as a string to preserve formatting

member.summary: Number of missed cleavages (internal K or R)

member.name: T:PHRPReader.PeptideCleavageStateCalculator
member.summary: This class will compute the cleavage state and terminus state of a given peptide sequence. It can also be used to remove modification symbols from a sequence using ExtractCleanSequenceFromSequenceWithMods

remarks.para: The sequence can simply contain single-letter amino acid symbols (capital letters) or a mix of amino acid symbols and modification symbols, for example: R.PEPTIDEK.L R.P*EPTIDEK.L R.PEPTIDEK*.L

Method ComputeCleavageState is overloaded to either except the peptide sequence with prefix and suffix letters (e.g. R.PEPTIDEK.L) or accept the primary peptide sequence, the prefix residue(s), and the suffix residue(s).
Use EnzymeMatchSpec to specify the residues to match for cleavage
The default cleavage specification is for trypsin: [KR]|[^P]

Note: Method SplitPrefixAndSuffixFromSequence will change peptides that look like: E.TGMLTQKFARSLGMLAVDNQARV.. to E.TGMLTQKFARSLGMLAVDNQARV. or ..TGMLTQKFARSLGMLAVDNQARV.R to .TGMLTQKFARSLGMLAVDNQARV.R

member.summary: Regular expression for the residue to the left of cleavage points for the given enzyme

member.summary: Regular expression for the residue to the right of cleavage points for the given enzyme

member.name: T:PHRPReader.StartupOptions
member.remarks: Use these options to define load behavior to be used when instantiating PHRP reader

member.name: P:PHRPReader.StartupOptions.DisableOpeningInputFiles
member.summary: When true, do not try to open the input file This allows the input file to be non-existent, or even an empty string
member.remarks: Note that some methods (e.g. LoadSearchEngineParameters) accept a filename but not a full path To allow for the InputDirectoryPath to be initialized, instantiate the reader with a full path to a non-existent file
